p: Table 1 also shows the effects of concomitant treatment with L-NAME and either the aqueous extract of A. digitata or captopril on the relative weight of the heart, the left ventricle, and kidneys. The relative weights of the heart and of left ventricle were increased significantly (27.67 %, p < 0.05, and 48.07%, p < 0.001, respectively) in hypertensive control animals ( Table 1). Treatment with captopril and plant extract doses 100 and 200 mg/kg mitigated this increase ( Table 1). Relative weight of kidneys was also increased significantly in the hypertensive control group (0.79 ± 0.05 vs. 0.59 ± 0.05 g/100 g BW in the normotensive control group, p < 0.05) ( Table 1). This detrimental change was prevented in groups receiving the extract at doses 100 or 200 mg/kg, or captopril ( p < 0.05) ( Table 1).
